title: Musicians who oppose Donald Trump's use of their music
deleted: [[John Fogerty]] found the use of "[[Fortunate Son]]" a curious choice at a Trump campaign rally in Michigan on September 10, 2020, posting a video on Facebook and Instagram saying, “It’s a song I could have written now, and so I find it confusing, I would say, that the president has chosen to use my song for his political rallies when in fact, it seems like he is probably the fortunate son.”<ref>{{Cite web|last=Wingrove|first=Josh|date=|title=Trump Baffles Songwriter John Fogerty by Using Band’s ‘Fortunate Son’ at Rally|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-11/trump-is-fortunate-son-fogerty-says-after-song-played-at-rally|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2020-09-12|website=www.bloomberg.com}}</ref>

title: Musicians who oppose Donald Trump's use of their music
deleted: On October 19, 2020, John Fogerty has directed Trump to stop using his song "Fortunate Son," by issuing him a cease-and-desist order. [[Rock legend John Fogerty issues President Trump a cease-and-desist order from playing his song. <ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cnn.com/2020/10/19/us/john-fogerty-tells-trump-to-stop-playing-his-song-trnd/index.html}}</ref>
